tooltips.hide: Click to remove a degree from the scale. This lets you keep only chord tones: 1, 3, 5
tooltips.tonal: Changes the tonic of the scale. Degrees and chords are built from it
tooltips.modal: Shifting the interval pattern changes the mode. Moving 5 steps right gives the Aeolian mode (natural minor)
tooltips.degrees: Shifts the center within the scale. The mode changes without altering the notes, unlike modal shift
tooltips.center: The center is the root note of the scale. It is always the first degree and the reference point for chords, regardless of context
tooltips.context: Context builds the scale from a related key around the center. For example, F gives B♭ for C7
tooltips.fretboard: The first string is the thinnest. Click on the open fret to configure that string. This allows custom tuning.

content.pageDescription: An interactive music theory calculator for building scales, chords, and interval patterns.
content.sectionTheoryText: This tool helps you learn music theory through visualization. Choose a tonic, build an interval pattern, and see how scales and chords look on different instruments.
content.sectionAudienceText: This tool is designed for beginner musicians and anyone studying the basics of music theory, regardless of their instrument.
content.sectionInstrumentsText: Visualization is available for keyboard and string instruments. In the future, string instruments will support configuring the number of strings for bass, ukulele, and other instruments.
content.footerText: Interactive Music Theory • Scales • Chords • Intervals
content.aboutTooltip: — a red note is a tooltip with useful information. Works on hover and touch on mobile.
content.fretboardInfo: Different note colors on the guitar fretboard indicate the octave. You can adjust the tuning of each string.
